WRITING.TEXT: That is absolutely charming.

Yeah, I take a tiny dose because my psychiatrist has had some success using it off label to reduce the intrusive thoughts and compulsive behavior associated with eating disorders and compulsive exercise.
I just started Zyprexa!

WRITING.TITLE: I could really use a hug and a pep talk right now (ED mentions maybe TW?)
WRITING.TEXT:
Right now I'm in eating disorder treatment 10 hours a day, 7 days a week living halfway across the country from my family and I'm feeling super bummed today.
My roommates are great but they don't know about what is going on so I still feel super lonely and discouraged because despite 10 days in the hospital and 2 weeks of PHP I'm still not medically cleared to walk around Target despite working my ass off in treatment.
My mom has been a mess ever since I was in the hospital (she told me that she starts to panic whenever I don't answer a text because she can't help but think I could be dead) and while I am open with her I don't want her to feel like she has to fly out here or make her feel guilty that she can't be here.
My body image is terrible and I feel physically awful and overly full and I have so many emotions going on I just need to vent to someone who isn't another therapist or patient for a hot minute because no matter how many times they tell me I still can't believe that I am underweight (though I have stopped denying that I'm not in the best place medically).
I don't know what I need, I just needed to get that out and let myself be a mess because I am not even 20 years old and while I'm doing my best, I've had this disorder for close to half of my life and been through treatment enough times to know what to expect but now I'm just sad, overwhelmed and lonely.

I'm actually feeling motivated to push myself and recover from my eating disorder!
I posted here a few weeks ago when I was first hospitalized and figured I'd update; I spent 10 days in the pediatric hospital getting medically stabilized (which is boring as fuck when you are almost 20) and got discharged just in time to take my finals and finish my sophomore year of college. Now I am in a 10 hour a day, 7 day a week PHP program and while I didn't want to do it initially I am starting to see how much I needed this help and accept that I am where I need to be right now.
I am experiencing a lot of body image distress because despite the 11 prescription medications I am currently taking I have trouble accepting that I am actually 'sick' and truly believe that I look fine and my weight isn't a problem (but I the way I got to this weight is) but I am showing up to program every day and have made it through the last 2 days without refusing and meals, snacks, supplements (both prescribed and ones given if a meal isn't finished.)
I feel gross and fluffy as I am on a "zero movement plan" (today I was told that walking around Target is considered 'exercise') and my meal plan feels insane (I can post it if you want) but I am doing this and even if I don't want this for myself it breaks my heart to know how much anxiety I have been causing my parents.
Downingtown?
*at the point of care
Not to mention too old.

N O P E
Don't do it homie. I'm only a little older than you but I can promise that no good will come of restricting and getting to a low weight; best case you come to your senses and spend a few weeks being miserable for no good reason, worst case you're stuck with an eating disorder, and these things fucking suck.
I'm always here to talk if you want (about this, or any number of unrelated topics)

Have you ever heard of Familial Hypercholesterolemia? I did a project on it for a genetics course and it is a relatively common genetic disorder (estimated incidence of heterozygous form is 1/250 people worldwide) that is rarely diagnosed because high cholesterol is so common treatable that a lot of doctors might not feel the need to look for the etiology if a patient is asymptomatic (when you hear hoofbeats think horses, not zebras!)
People with this condition inherited faulty genes from one or both parents (it is a dominant disorder, but if you are homozygous, which is rare its usually pretty severe) and their livers suck at metabolizing and getting rid of cholesterol. This leads to excessively high HDL cholesterol and increases the risk of premature cardiovascular disease.
I am NOT trying to diagnose you or anything, this just came to mind when I read that you are a young, healthy weight individual with a family hx of super early onset cardiovascular disease who has elevated cholesterol.
https://thefhfoundation.org/about-fh/what-is-fh
My mom is still mad that they stopped making them before she was able to get one.

I love Subarus, right now I have a 2009 Forester that I will drive until it dies since its paid off (it was a family car that my parents gifted to me because my sister pretty much doesn't drive and they didn't need a third car), then I really want an Impreza because I loooove station wagons.

Woo hoo!
I have a 2009 and my only real complaint is the gosh awful gas mileage (on a long highway trip I might get 25mpg but I live in the city so I'm happy to get 20mpg)

Thats literally my dream car.
I don't know why, but I love me a station wagon.

I dealt with a fair amount of emotional/psychological/verbal abuse as a kid and still struggle, but I have had several friends who were abused both physically/sexually and verbally say that the verbal stuff is harder to deal with because it is less concrete. All abuse is traumatic but physical abuse is more concrete; people have an easier time drawing that line and saying that it is fucked up and never ok that that person hit me where it is so much easier to justify and excuse words.

My parents were like this with academics; if I got an A- because I didn't turn in homework and could have gotten an A they would be pissed but they were still proud of me the time that I ended up getting a 79 in calculus because I worked my ass off and really did try my best.

It was ok.
I was in the hospital for 10 days being treated for medical complications of my eating disorder and refeeding syndrome and I got discharged Friday evening and while I was glad to be out (being an adult in a pediatric hospital is super boring) returning to the real world was a bit overwhelming, and going about my usual business is exhausting after 6 days of complete bed rest and 4 days of bed rest plus 2 short slow walks around the hospital.
Also, finals start today so I spend a lot of time trying to study because I never feel prepared.
I want to stay out of the hospital but eating the amount I am supposed to is so hard and time consuming, and I'm so petrified of gaining weight in any form that the idea of gaining fat that I really don't think I need is making it super challenging.

I haven't had an Oreo since like 2012 (not a choice, I have celiac) but my mom said that they are different now and they suck?
Sorry your comment just made me think of that.
I wrote Harry Potter x Wicked crossover fanfiction *shudders*

It was fine, I had some good times and positive formative experiences but I don't miss it and I was more than ready to get out and move on by the time that I graduated.
For me, high school served its purpose; I grew a lot as a person, developed social skills, had my first boyfriend, got a handle on my mental health issues and learned how to translate being smart and curious into being a good student.
I really don't talk to anyone that I was friends with in high school (besides my ex boyfriend who is still one of my closest friends) and I'm totally cool with that. I wasn't bullied and I was friendly with plenty of people but I didn't have close friends who I really feel the need to keep up with. The people that I hung out in high school are great and I'm sure we would have fun if we ended up running into each other somewhere but ultimately most of us didn't have a ton in common besides being nice, in AP classes and legally obligated to be in the same building together 5 days a week.

My grandma always talks about how hard her first few years of marriage were because of this! Her mom was very much a perfectionist who liked things done her way so she never let my grandma learn how to do things like cook or clean (according to my grandmother, her mother literally made her bed for her on the day of her wedding) so when she got married at 20 she had no idea how to cook a meal or take care of a house.

One of my good friends has happily divorced parents and it really showed me how much of a net positive it can be. They did not work as a married couple, but they respect and care about each other and always put the kids first so my friend always talks about how great it was to have the best of her 2 loving parents plus 2 "bonus adults" (both remarried to super nice people who fit into the role of "positive adult who cares but respects boundaries and doesn't try to be a parent")

Plus, you can give them choices. My sister can be pretty lazy and my parents told her that she HAD to do some sort of physical activity; they didn't care what it was she just had to be doing some sort of exercise at least once a week.
And that is the story of how my ended up taking circus arial classes.

My parents required that we be involved in something active whether that meant an organized team sport, marching band, training for a 10K with a friend or circus arial classes which is what I plan on doing with my kids.
If it makes you feel better, those were LPN schools (not saying LPNs aren't important but its not a degree program)
If you haven't already, look up Old Friends Senior Dog Sanctuary on Facebook!

I get really annoyed when people don't listen to experts because "they know better" but here I am insisting that I am fine and my weight is completely healthy while sitting in a hospital bed on bedrest and 24 hour cardiac monitoring and fall precautions.
Eating disorders are fun.
I know people who take their dog to daycare a few days a week while they are at work so that pupper gets some extra stimulation and playtime.

People who have super overweight pets and think that it is cute.
I get that pets can get a bit chunky as they get older but it breaks my heart to see obese dogs waddling around because a.) it is hard on their little joints and b.) being super overweight and having crappy joints prevents them from doing the things that make them the happiest (running around, sniffing, exploring).
When you have a pet, it is your job to take care of it and overfeeding it and not providing it with enough exercise just isn't fair to the animal.

I totally agree that adopting is great, heck I worked at an animal rescue all through high school but I can also see why some people choose not to go that route and have no problem with people getting dogs from a responsible breeders who produce healthy dogs and carefully screen their clients.
For someone who has never had a dog before it can be great to get one from someone who knows a lot about the breed and can provide follow up, plus, you will already have some idea what you are getting yourself into when it comes to size, shedding, activity needs and demeanor (obviously, each individual dog has its own quirks but breeds are known for different personality traits).
Getting dogs from a pet store or puppy mill is shitty and I am not down with that but I am not willing to judge people who want to get breeder dogs because adopting might not be for everyone every time.
I can't decide which cult of recovery I hate more: MM or Maudsley.

I'm so proud of you!
Right now I'm stuck in the hospital and it is so hard to get down all of the meals and fluids because I still don't think that I need to gain weight but I need to get out of here to take my finals so I'm doing it!

Usually its Dilaudid with Phenargen or benadryl.
Some people legitimately do feel really sick to their stomachs with pain meds and an antiemetic can be beneficial but like so many other things you can't help but raise an eyebrow when people request a cocktail by name.
I was taught to ask what level they were at and then what they would consider acceptable or tolerable with the understanding that zero is probably not a realistic short term goal.

Everyone has their things, like even thinking to hard about snot or spit makes me a little gaggy.
I would gladly deal with poop, urine, blood, vomit, pus or pretty much any other body fluid before I would brush someones teeth or suction respiratory secretions.
No, s/he is talking about people who want to refill their controlled medications super early, implying that they are taking too much or selling it.
TBH most NPR personalities could get it.

Sickboy!
It is three Canadian friends (one of whom has cystic fibrosis) who have super candid, funny conversations with people about living with their physical and mental health problems and disabilities. The show isn't about disease processes or anything like that it is just people talking about the realities of living with their illness or disability (one of my favorite moments was a young gay man with cancer talking about how he would go meet Grindr hookups when he still had a picc line in from his treatment and how awkward it was to just hope they would ignore it because talking about how you might be dying is a real mood killer).

Its super tasty! It isn't super sweet if you use a natural nut butter but if you use something like [this](https://wildfriendsfoods.com/collections/all/products/sugar-cookie-peanut-butter) it can be almost like a dessert.

You could use it as a dip, just use it the same way you would use butter or sour cream.
I also like cutting open a baked sweet potato and stuffing it with almond butter so it gets all melty.

Roasted, baked or steamed sweet potato with peanut or almond butter.
If we're talking white potatoes, my favorites are fries and hashbrowns (both high quality and shitty fast food potato pucks)
Sweet potatoes with peanut or almond butter are my go to.

Losing a dog is really hard especially when it is one that you grew up with.
I am so sorry for your loss but it sounds like he had a great, long life and knew that he was loved until the very end.

Yeah I have Celiac but I eat Dominos every once in a while because I very rarely have a reaction and since I have GI problems, things are never going to be firing on all cylinders so I may as well take a few moderate risks and get to feel like a normal person sometimes.

I generally try to have compassion for people who have committed crimes because none of us are perfect but as far as I'm concerned, if you drive drunk you are a garbage human and deserve to whatever punishment you get.

If a kid is so unwilling to eat non crap food that they are truly starving themselves, they have a medical, psychological, sensory or developmental problem that needs to be addressed and treated by professionals. Healthy, developmentally typical kids do not starve themselves and a few missed meals is not dangerous.

Yeah, I'm in the US and while I lived on a single sex dorm floor there were no restrictions on the gender of visitors. We generally had male guests use the bathroom on one of the male floors but that wasn't an enforced rule, just common courtesy since we had a communal bathroom and not everyone wants to run into a strange dude when they get out of the shower.
Those big light up ones are the worst because even if yo aren't trying to look it is hard to not be distracted by a big LED screen showing what basically amounts to a slideshow of different ads.

I finally decided to listen to my doctors "Strong Recommendation" and allow myself to be admitted to the hospital for my eating disorder. I'm feeling really guilty about missing school and how much this is going to cost my parents (because 'Merica) but I am proud of myself for acting like an adult and doing something that I really don't want to do for the sake of my future health and happiness. I also feel like I'm way too heavy and feel too good to warrant this level of intervention but now that I'm here and have monitors beeping constantly I realized that I should not feel kinda tired after changing my clothes, and my heartrate should not go from 51 to over 100 after standing for a minute.
THIS IS SELF CARE AND IT SUCKS! Hopefully I'll be off complete bed rest tomorrow but today is just me in my bed with the foam egg crate pad to protect my boney body (I don't know why I have it but I'm not complaining), 3 meals, 3 snacks and heart monitors that WILL NOT STOP BEEPING.

Where I'm from, lot of peoples parents time it so that one parent will be due for a new car around the time that the kid starts driving, so mom or dad will get a new car and the kid will drive the old one. I also know a fair number of people who were expected to contribute to their car in some way whether they bought it themselves or had to pay the parents a certain amount, or their parents got them a car but they were on the hook for paying to maintain it to and maybe some of their insurance.
I also know people who inherited cars from a grandparent/older relative who passed away/stopped driving.
Used cars aren't too expensive if you know where to look and are patient (my dad gets all of our cars used; he is into BMWs and since they depreciate fast he got his last car for cheap from a guy who just always had to have the newest one). Oddly, it can be harder to find a decent used Honda or Subaru because people hold onto them forever.
Yesss I have found my people. I've never understood the appeal.
It has been my dream since childhood to have an orange tabby named pumpkin so this makes me incredibly happy.
Engaging in some joyful movement and doing cat yoga!
They look like they are filming a buddy cop movie that I would 110% watch.
Major is so goofy looking but also kind of majestic I love him.

My sister aways tells me hat I look like the human equivalent of a greyhound but I could only dream of a booty like that one!
I've heard that they are pretty lazy except when sprinting full tilt, have you found that they are willing to take longer walks or runs?
Your cat is prettier than I could ever hope to be.
SUCH A GOOD BOY!

[My good boy who I miss like crazy since I am away at college. My passion is making people look at pictures of my dog so there is plenty more where these came from if you're into that](http://imgur.com/a/OiYyG)
Yup! I'll try a bite of pretty much anything but I just don't end up liking a lot of things and honestly, food doesn't interest me enough to spend time seeking out new things.
I prefer the term "car hoarder" but yours works too!

A pretty large percentage of East Asian people (Chinese, Korean and Japanese) actually have a genetic mutation that causes them to have less body odor and fewer apocrine sweat glands than people with the functional version of that gene, so they sweat less and when they do sweat it doesn't produce much odor.

This brings me back to my freshman year of college...
My mom was horrified when I told her about this combo until I explained that I mostly used it to get around open container laws.
Now I've grown up a bit and prefer to add Jack to my 20oz bottle of Diet Coke when I'm day drinking on the go (college is fun)

This is why I am so glad to go to be in a shitlord nursing program.
Freshman year in our "Success in College and Nursing" class (basic freshman class in every major) we had a whole unit on weight control and had an assignment where we had to use MFP for a week and reflect on on our own choices and how it could be helpful to patients.
We also have to take a pretty hardcore nutrition course taught by a shitlord PhD who specializes in obesity research.

I recently found one called Sickboy that I have been enjoying; it is a group of 3 friends, one of whom has cystic fibrosis who talk to people about their illnesses in a funny, candid way. Its not a medical podcast per se but I have found it educational to hear lay people's perspectives on illnesses and they often talk about the practical concerns of living with a disease (my favorite was a young gay man with cancer talking about how awkward it was to meet reassure his Grindr hookups that he was fine and they could just ignore the picc line).

Yeah, a lot of my friends who are in recovery and trying to weight restore eat dates stuffed with peanut butter or almond butter because its a lot of calories in a small package and a lot of people recovering from eating disorders struggle with the sensation of feeling full.

Yup!
I have an eating disorder and I'm not doing too well right now (restricting and purging a ton) but my bloodwork is pretty much normal because human bodies are really good at maintaining homeostasis. When labs come back abnormal that isn't the first sign that you have a problem, it is a sign that your body can no longer compensate for the damage done by your disease process/shitty life choices.
Yeah, milk, eggs and their components are in EVERYTHING and kids with severe allergies to those things seem to do alright.
They are like the amoxicillin of assholes.
I agree, it felt like a very equal exchange; they were both lovable oddballs that lived in a world that the other found fascinating.
My mom watches that and yells encouragement at the TV like she is watching a sports game. Its really endearing that she gets so invested in the lives of these random people.

I got addicted to Forensic Files in eating disorder treatment. They had this weird ass cable package and not a lot of channels (basically trying to avoid triggering stuff I guess) but one of the channels played Forensic Files marathons that I would DVR (along with Jeopardy) and watch at night (provided certain staff didn't put a stop to it).

I got the same response when I talked about carrots and PB.
Is that not a normal combo...

Eating disorder: In a lot of ways I think it can be compared to drug addiction or OCD; when I am in a bad place my behaviors feel like the only way to get relief from my anxiety and as weird as it sounds, purging or restricting does make me feel better. It isn't that I want to do these things I'm just scared of what will happen if I don't which is how I felt about other compulsive behaviors (hand washing) that I engaged in when I was a kid. Intellectually, I completely understand why what I am doing is unhealthy (I'm a nursing major for goodness sake) but the idea of changing my behavior is so overwhelming it seems impossible and at some level, I really don't want to change because recovery is just a different kind of hard and uncomfortable. Despite what my doctor and blood tests say; I can't accept that my weight is not healthy which runs so contrary to my frustration with people who deny science and ignore experts because "they know better".
I'm petrified of gaining weight and I still refuse to believe that I need to and once I enter the cycle of restricting it the number of calories that I consider "too much" gets smaller and smaller.

When I was in residential eating disorder treatment we had a few Canadian girls who were there because the wait times for mental health services in Canada can be super long and from what I have been told there aren't as many specialized treatment centers especially outside of an urban area.
Most of the girls care was still covered by their Canadian healthcare and they were approved for 90 days of coverage with possible extensions when they came up for review where most Americans were fighting with their insurance multiple times a week to get another few days covered.
Doctors who work in hospitals really don't deal with insurance at all, they treat the patients on their service and the billing department worries about payment for the most part.
Flopping down in a bean bag chair and finding out that it is full of cold cat urine because your mostly blind 17 year old kitty mistook the beans for kitty litter.
If someone wants to work as a provider right away and doesn't want to spend time at the bedside they should go to medical school.

Yup. There are some great NPs out there but if I had to choose a provider based on degree alone I would go PA every time.
A doc that I talked to said that she trusts NPs as individuals and PAs as a profession.

Corn.
It always baffled my parents but I've never managed more than a bite without gagging.
Eh, for a woman 5'7'' is taller than average but still well within the range of normal in the US.

I'm a bit over 5'7'' and I honestly thing that it is the perfect height because most of the world was made for people our size since we fall almost exactly between the average (American) man and the average (American) woman.
Sure, I'm taller than most of my friends on paper but I don't stick out of a crowd as "tall" since I'm only 4ish inches above average and a lot of women are in the 5'4'' to 5'6'' range.

Yes.
I'm 1/2 black but my 100% Polish ex boyfriend had a better ass than I could ever dream of having.

I view it similar to the way I view self deprecating humor; it can be funny/effective when done well in the right context but it gets really old really fast if a person uses it too much or doesn't use it well.
You also have to know your audience and not assume that other people in that group are ok with you calling them that word.

Have you tried air popped popcorn? You get the same crunch and it is a high volume low calorie food so you can eat a lot of it. Plus you can add whatever flavor you want to it while still keeping it low calorie (salt is good and all but I love adding spices or Trader Joes chili lime seasoning)

I agree. I'm in the US but from what I saw working in retail as a teenager and now doing clinical rotations as a nursing major; the most unpleasant population to deal with is people between the ages of 50 and 75 (give or take).

Unless you were on Rifampin which is the only antibiotic that has been shown to decrease the effectiveness of hormonal birth control your doctor was correct.
It is actually an interesting topic because it is such a widespread misconception.
That was my experience too. My doc did do a pelvic when I became sexually active and then told me that I wouldn't need another until I'm 21 unless I was having a gynecological issue.
Its mostly to make sure that the GI tract has come back online since it is the last system to "wake up" after surgery.
Pretty much. The GI tracts is the last thing to come back online after being under GA so they want to make sure that it does and you don't have a paralytic ileus or something.
Same here! I'll try a bite of anything (as long as it doesn't contain gluten, or one of my absolute no go foods of which there are few) but if left to my own devices I eat a pretty limited diet.

I'm a vegetable loving picky eater!
I'm not disputing your point at all, which is why I almost never refer to myself as "picky" but I eat a pretty limited diet and my favorite foods are brown rice, plain tofu, sweet potatoes, broccoli/brussel sprouts, cauliflower and various fruits.
There are dozens of us!
I think that the sound of a cat bringing up a hairball is about 100x worse than the actual mess.

So they're the human version(s) of golden retrievers.
I want to hang out with these people.
I mean at a lot of places its an organized thing with activities and snacks not just people bringing elementary schoolers to sit in a cube with them all day (though I'm sure some people do do that)

People who see being under caffeinated and up early as an excuse to act like an asshole.
I get that not everyone is chipper in the morning but be a grown up and suck it up; we're all tired.

Peanut butter is my go to oatmeal topping; I had a dietician suggest it as a way to increase my calories without adding a ton of volume but its so good its the only way I'm willing to eat peanut butter.

Speaking from personal experience, there is no worse feeling than being in the middle of an Ikea and realizing that you are about to throw up.

Yeah, I have the Classic III and don't have any complaints.

Yeah, I have no complaints about my Classic 3.

Students/techs with $200+ cardiology stethoscopes.

Yeah, I've noticed this too. I tend to isolate myself but my studio apartment is way too small for me to try and pace around, so I end up going out to walk and have found that a.) just getting out improves my mood and b.) I end up being more social because I run into friends and since I'm already out I'll hang out with them.

Thats like something out of a Judy Bloom book!
You got "the gift of womanhood"

I use the pill. I have never had a regular period because of my eating disorder and skipped it for 3 years in high school (I still don't even get withdrawal bleeds on the pill most months) but there is some evidence that having a more regular hormonal cycle will at least slow down my rate of bone loss or even improve my bone density.
Plus, I'm in college and sometimes struggle to keep myself alive, I don't think I should risk making another human.
You play second violin :p
